evals.name: strong-match-concise-letter
evals.prompt: Resume is tailored, now write the cover letter for the HealthFirst VP of Engineering role.
evals.expected_output: Short formal cover letter (3 paragraphs). Leads with specific interest in HealthFirst's value-based care scaling challenge. Highlights 2-3 strongest matches with numbers. Minimal gap addressing since it's a strong match. Under one page.
evals.context: Application folder at 2026-02-24_healthfirst_vp-engineering with metadata showing overall: strong, tailored resume complete.

assertions.text: Letter body contains exactly 3-4 paragraphs (not counting salutation/closing)
Opening paragraph references something specific to HealthFirst (e.g., scaling to 1M lives, value-based care tools) — not generic praise
Body includes at least 2 quantified achievements from achievements.md
Uses formal business tone — no contractions, no casual phrasing
Letter fits on a single page

evals.name: stretch-match-gap-addressing
evals.prompt: Write the cover letter for the Netflix DevOps Platform Lead position. It's a stretch but I want to make my case.
evals.expected_output: Slightly longer cover letter (4 paragraphs). Acknowledges the stretch honestly. Frames CI/CD and infrastructure experience as directly transferable. Addresses platform engineering gap through architecture experience. Doesn't pretend streaming infrastructure experience exists.
evals.context: Application folder at 2026-02-24_netflix_devops-platform-lead with metadata showing overall: stretch, hard gaps in streaming infrastructure and chaos engineering.

assertions.text: Addresses at least one addressable gap by framing adjacent experience as a strength (not by saying 'I lack...')
Does not claim streaming infrastructure or chaos engineering experience that doesn't exist in achievements.md
Body makes a genuine argument for why the candidate is worth interviewing despite the gaps — not just listing skills
Uses formal business tone — no contractions, no casual phrasing

evals.name: former-employer-return-narrative
evals.prompt: Cover letter for the Cognizant Chief Architect role — remember this is my old company.
evals.expected_output: Short letter (3 paragraphs). Leads with the return narrative — what's changed since leaving. Emphasizes post-Cognizant growth (AI/ML, value-based care, CTO scope). Does not rehash Cognizant experience at length.
evals.context: Application folder at 2026-02-24_cognizant_chief-architect with metadata showing former_employer: true.

assertions.text: Letter explicitly mentions returning to Cognizant or references the prior tenure
Body focuses on what the candidate gained SINCE leaving (CTO at ilumed, AI/ML integration, value-based care)
Does not spend more than 1 sentence describing what the candidate did AT Cognizant previously
Uses formal business tone — no contractions, no casual phrasing
